To subscribe or unsubscribe via the World Wide Web, visit
	http://duvel.te.verweg.com/cgi-bin/mailman/listinfo/msn-list
or, via email, send a message with subject or body 'help' to
	msn-list-request@te.verweg.com

You can reach the person managing the list at
	msn-list-owner@te.verweg.com

When replying, please edit your Subject line so it is more specific
than "Re: Contents of MSN-list digest..."


archive of the list:
http://msn-list.te.verweg.com/

Today's Topics:

   1. Russia. Stolen painting found in car
      (Museum Security Network Mailing list)
   2. Paraguay. Im?genes jesu?ticas de los santos fueron ofertadas
      en 30.000 d?lares (Museum Security Network Mailing list)
   3. Vandal damages China's iconic Mao portrait
      (Museum Security Network Mailing list)

Message: 1
Date: Sun, 13 May 2007 14:57:01 +0200
From: Museum Security Network Mailing list 
Subject: [MSN] Russia. Stolen painting found in car
To: Museum Security Network Mailinglist 
Message-ID: <46470B1D.3070305@bruggemansolutions.com>
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8; format=flowed

Stolen painting found in car
Three Russian men charged in theft of artwork from gallery
By CLAUDIA MEL?NDEZ SALINAS
Herald Salinas Bureau
Monterey County Herald
Article Last Updated:05/12/2007 01:26:36 AM PDT
Three Russian nationals have been charged with stealing a Russian 
master's painting from a Carmel art gallery.

On Friday, Judge Russell Scott set bail at $50,000 for Anatoliy 
Valsilvich Melnik, and at $30,000 for Vadir Vatalevich Shavlovsky and 
Victor Ivaschenko. The men were arrested late Monday near the Simic New 
Renaissance Gallery in Carmel, police said, after the gallery's alarm 
was set off.

The painting, "Sailor's Delight," a seascape by Russian master Eugene 
Garin valued at $40,000, was cut from its frame before the gallery 
closed, Detective Jesse Juarez said.

About 20 minutes before midnight, police said, burglars tried to break 
into the gallery, triggering the alarm. Melnik, Shavlovsky and 
Ivaschenko were detained by officers soon after. When their vehicle was 
searched, "Sailor's Delight" was found inside.

"It is believed (they returned) to steal more high-valued art," Juarez said.

Deputy District Attorney Dennis LaBarbara persuaded Scott to set bail 
higher, saying the men could pose a flight risk.

Bail for Melnik, 30, was set higher because there is an outstanding 
warrant for his arrest in Sacramento for a probation violation, 
LaBarbara said. Melnik is wanted in other counties for violating 
probation in at least one burglary case.

LaBarbara wanted higher bail for Shavlovsky because he is believed to 
live in Portland, Ore.

Defense attorney Scott Erdbacher, who is representing Ivaschenko, argued 
that his client was not a flight risk because he has lived in Sacramento 
for decades, and has family and children.

The men are charged with burglary and attempted burglary, and with 
possession of stolen property. They will appear in court Wednesday.

Garin, born in the Soviet Republic of Ukraine in 1922, is one of the 
most popular painters of marine landscapes. He immigrated to the United 
States about 1960 and painted scenes of California's coast.

Claudia Mel?ndez Salinas can be reached at 753-6755 or 
cmelendez@montereyherald.com.

http://www.montereyherald.com

Message: 2
Date: Mon, 14 May 2007 09:09:52 +0200
From: Museum Security Network Mailing list 
Subject: [MSN] Paraguay. Im?genes jesu?ticas de los santos fueron
	ofertadas en 30.000 d?lares
To: Museum Security Network Mailinglist 
Message-ID: <46480B40.6020204@bruggemansolutions.com>
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8; format=flowed

LA POLICIA MANEJA DATOS DEL PRIMER VENDEDOR, QUE SERIA DE ENCARNACION
Im?genes jesu?ticas de los santos fueron ofertadas en 30.000 d?lares

Las tallas jesu?ticas policromadas de Santa B?rbara y de San Jos? con el Ni?o Jes?s en brazos, robadas en febrero del 2003 del templo San Cosme y Dami?n (Itap?a), fueron recuperadas cuando estaban a punto de ser vendidas por 30.000 d?lares por el restaurador chileno Hern?n Pedro Galarce Salinas, quien est? detenido.

Los agentes de Interpol Paraguay, que tiene una oficina encargada de investigar el robo de patrimonios hist?ricos, recibieron una informaci?n de que el restaurador y comerciante chileno Hern?n Pedro Galarce Salinas (de 45 a?os) ofertaba en 30.000 d?lares dos valiosas im?genes de santos. Este fue imputado ayer por reducci?n, seg?n confirm? la fiscala Teresa Sosa. Los polic?as iniciaron una investigaci?n sobre la sustracci?n de obras ocurridas en los ?ltimos a?os. Se percataron de que la oferta podr?a estar relacionada con el caso de robo del templo de San Cosme y Dami?n, departamento de Itap?a, que se produjo en febrero del 2003.

Ante esta situaci?n, la Interpol contrat? a una mujer espa?ola, quien, junto a una agente de la referida unidad, se traslad? hasta la casa del extranjero, en las calles Velilla 1870 entre 6? y 7? Proyectada, barrio Obrero de la capital. Ambas simularon estar interesadas en la adquisici?n de las obras, aunque la intenci?n era descubrir si efectivamente se trataba de las im?genes jesu?ticas de Santa B?rbara y de San Jos?, que lleva en sus brazos al Ni?o Jes?s. En el lugar, el chileno Galarce Salinas ofert? las im?genes a las supuestas compradoras en 30.000 d?lares, conforme a los datos policiales.

Sin embargo, seg?n los investigadores, el monto iba a ser extremadamente superior si las obras eran trasladadas a Europa, ya que el extranjero tambi?n pretend?a llevar las tallas a Francia, luego de terminar la restauraci?n, que ya hab?a realizado en m?s de 50%.

Seg?n los datos, en el citado pa?s europeo iba a comercializarlas en dos millones de d?lares. La conversaci?n entre las dos mujeres y el chileno sirvi? a los investigadores para allanar la vivienda de este ?ltimo.

Galarce Salinas dijo a los intervinientes que el 12 de febrero pasado adquiri? las tallas de Encarnaci?n y facilit? el apellido de la persona que le hab?a entregado. Los investigadores tambi?n poseen algunos n?meros telef?nicos.

Arzobispado y templo, en disputa
La fiscala Teresa Sosa revel? que tanto el Arzobispado de Asunci?n como el templo San Cosme y Dami?n, de donde se robaron los santos, enviaron sendas solicitudes para que se les entreguen las tallas, lo que genera cierta disputa.

Message: 3
Date: Mon, 14 May 2007 09:09:58 +0200
From: Museum Security Network Mailing list 
Subject: [MSN] Vandal damages China's iconic Mao portrait
To: Museum Security Network Mailinglist 
Message-ID: <46480B46.5010609@bruggemansolutions.com>
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8; format=flowed

Vandal damages China's iconic Mao portrait
Sat May 12, 2007 12:20PM EDT

BEIJING (Reuters) - A vandal damaged the giant portrait of China's late Chairman Mao Zedong that hangs over the Forbidden City on Saturday, prompting police to clear the area and adjacent Tiananmen Square, witnesses said.

Most of the picture was intact, but workers could be seen in a crane cleaning the lower left area of the huge portrait, which appeared damaged by soot after the vandal hurled a burning object at it. Police were swarming the area.

Traffic could pass by, but Tiananmen, the symbolic heart of Communist China, was temporarily cleared of the visitors that normally crowd the square on weekends and the tourist-clogged entrance to the Forbidden City was emptied.

Police later let visitors back onto the square, which remained under tight security.

Police detained Gu Haiou, a 35-year-old unemployed man from Urumqi, capital of the far-northwestern region of Xinjiang, the official Xinhua news agency reported.

The damaged portrait would be replaced on Saturday night, the report said, adding armed guards were in the area and the Forbidden City was still closed to visitors. The portrait is periodically replaced with an identical copy.

Calls to the Beijing city government and the local police about the incident went unanswered.

Tiananmen is considered especially sensitive since it was the site of 1989 pro-democracy demonstrations that were crushed by the military. The area usually swarms with plainclothes security who quickly stamp out any signs of dissent.

China's leadership brooks no challenges to its authority, and damaging Mao's portrait could lead to a stiff punishment.

Chinese journalist Yu Dongyue was jailed for more than 16 years for hurling eggshells filled with red paint at the Mao portrait at the height of the 1989 demonstrations. He was mentally ill by the time he was released in February 2006.

Despite leading the country in a series of violent political movements that saw millions purged or killed and left the economy moribund, Mao is still revered by many in China and is seen as a symbol of its strength and unity.

http://www.reuters.com/

Message: 4
Date: Mon, 14 May 2007 09:10:04 +0200
From: Museum Security Network Mailing list 
Subject: [MSN] Dominican Republic. Desconocidos roban pintura de
	parroquia ensanche Claret
To: Museum Security Network Mailinglist 
Message-ID: <46480B4C.2080605@bruggemansolutions.com>
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8; format=flowed

Desconocidos roban pintura de parroquia ensanche Claret

Santo Domingo. Varios desconocidos penetraron a la parroquia San Antonio Mar?a de Claret, ubicada en la avenida John F. Kennedy con Winston Churchill y se llevaron un cuadro de la colecci?n del viacrucis.

La pintura desapareci? hace siete d?as de la nave principal de la parroquia lo que mantiene preocupados a los feligreses y al cura p?rroco, Alexis D?az.

Jos? del Carmen Ariza, quien hizo la denuncia, dijo que el nombre del cuadro es ?La Sepultura de Jes?s?, con un tama?o aproximado de 17? X 15?, pintado al ?leo, por uno de los m?s reconocidos pintores dominicanos.

?Tenemos la esperanza de que el que cometi? la profanaci?n, que se arrepienta y lo devuelva, para la tranquilidad de todos nosotros?, dijo.

Explic? que un empleado de la parroquia not? la desaparici?n de la pintura y que de inmediato lo comunic? a sus superiores, ?por lo que pedimos que el que la tenga, que nos la devuelva, porque es de un incalculable valor espiritual para todos nosotros?.

Solicit? la colaboraci?n de la polic?a,  ?con el fin de que llegue la tranquilidad a nuestra parroquia y a toda la comunidad?.

Dijo que cualquier informaci?n que pueda dar con el paradero de la pintura, puede ser  suministrada al tel?fono 809-566-9613, o a las oficinas de la propia parroquia.

- Adonis Santiago D?az

http://www.diariolibre.com
